result.execSummary:
All charges against Kwami Maya Boyd in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kwami Maya Boyd is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kwami Maya Boyd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kwami Maya Boyd appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Kwami Maya Boyd.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Kwami Maya Boyd appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Kwami Maya Boyd.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 10/10/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Kwami Maya Boyd in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kwami Maya Boyd in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and needs an offer from the State. Defense requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash Bail posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EJ and his children except as required for communication about the care of or exchange of children in common. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Kwami Maya Boyd in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and the Court amended Count 1 from a felony enhancer to a misdemeanor enhancer. Court found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
